= Use Cases for unix-privesc-check =

Unix-privesc-check support several use cases ("types"):

<pre>
# ./upc.sh --help
usage: ./upc.sh
Identifies potential privilege escalation paths.

	--help	display this help and exit
	--type	select from one of the following check types:
		all
		attack_surface
		quick
		sdl
		test
</pre>

Each "type" causes unix-privesc-check to run one or more modules.

The "types" are simply directories:
<pre>
# ls -l lib/checks/enabled/
total 20
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 2012-10-18 19:47 all
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 2012-10-18 19:47 attack_surface
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 2012-10-18 19:47 quick
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 2012-10-18 19:47 sdl
drwxr-xr-x 3 root root 4096 2012-10-18 19:47 test
</pre>

And the contents of each directory are the modules that will be run:
<pre>
# ls -l lib/checks/enabled/all/
total 0
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 19 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_banned -> ../../binary_banned
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 30 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_change_privileges -> ../../binary_change_privileges
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 19 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_chroot -> ../../binary_chroot
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 23 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_dependency -> ../../binary_dependency
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 16 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_pie -> ../../binary_pie
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 18 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_rpath -> ../../binary_rpath
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 16 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_ssp -> ../../binary_ssp
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 16 2012-10-18 19:47 binary_tmp -> ../../binary_tmp
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 17 2012-10-18 19:47 credentials -> ../../credentials
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 15 2012-10-18 19:47 gpg_agent -> ../../gpg_agent
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 20 2012-10-18 19:47 group_writable -> ../../group_writable
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root  9 2012-10-18 19:47 jar -> ../../jar
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 18 2012-10-18 19:47 key_material -> ../../key_material
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 19 2012-10-18 19:47 passwd_hashes -> ../../passwd_hashes
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 12 2012-10-18 19:47 setgid -> ../../setgid
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 12 2012-10-18 19:47 setuid -> ../../setuid
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 19 2012-10-18 19:47 shadow_hashes -> ../../shadow_hashes
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 15 2012-10-18 19:47 ssh_agent -> ../../ssh_agent
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 25 2012-10-18 19:47 ssh_key_unencrypted -> ../../ssh_key_unencrypted
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 22 2012-10-18 19:47 system_libraries -> ../../system_libraries
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 20 2012-10-18 19:47 world_writable -> ../../world_writable
</pre>

Run a particular "type" like this:
<pre>
./upc.sh --type all
</pre>
